logic.commentStep: When a set property operation is performed on the fetched KPI to add a new dynamic property threshold to it, the property is not added to it. The fetched KPIs doesn't seem to be the JS Object and the Object/Array operations (like set) are not working correctly, hence need to Stringify and then again convert it back to the Object.
If the color is changed then show an error message.
If more than maximum allowed intervals are present then show an error message and set only the maximum number of interval to the threshold in KPI.
Create a new Object and add objectId, sourceSystemCd and threshold of KPI to it.
Create the json data as required for the object selector component.

logic.commentStep: Check if KPIs.thresholds.intervals.restricted is set to true
Set the default colors based on threshold's better bound if user has changed the colors.
Check the number of threshold intervals are more than maximum allowed number then show an error message and remove the extra intervals.
Update the aInputDataThreshold value since it can be changed if more than maximum allowed intervals are removed.
Get the monitoring plan data i.e. pagedata
Get thresholds from the page data.
Check if the thresholds are present i.e. not null or undefined.
If thresholds are not present then add threshold from the input_data.
If the thresholds are present then check if the edited KPI is present or not.
Get the KPI's objectId and sourceSystemCd from the object selector.
If the edited KPI present then update the threshold in it.
Added this condition to handle the case when user opens the Threshold dialog and cancels it.
If the edited KPI is not present then add an object with kpiObjectId, kpiSourceSystemCd & threshold.
Remove the KPI itself if the Threshold is cleared.
